subject: Re: [junit] test protected method outside package
msgSnippet: Look the method up via reflection and call setAccessible(true) on it: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/reflect/Method.html -- Cédric ...
messageBody:
Look the method up via reflection and call setAccessible(true) on it:

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/reflect/Method.html

--
Cédric


On 3/2/06, Kamal Ahmed <KAhmed@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric,
>
> Excuse my ignorance, but I am not sure what is meant by "looking up method
> and setAccessable(true), is setAccessable(true) a method of JUnit 3.8.1?
>
>
>
> The Actual class and method is as below:
>
>
>
> public class JDBCPools {
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> private JDBCPools(String configDir) throws JDBCPoolsException {
>
> String poolDir = configDir + _FS + _POOL_DIR;
>
> loadPools(poolDir);
>
> String aliasDir = configDir + _FS + _ALIAS_DIR;
>
> loadAliases(aliasDir);
>
> initConnectionReaper();
>
> }
>
>
>
> Notice that the class is public, but the constructor is private.
>
> And I am stumped on how to test this.
>
> I really appreciate your help.
>
> Thanks,
>
> -Kamal.
